Events.text: The Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, used by several pre-Columbian Mesoamerican civilizations, notably the Maya, begins.
Events.html: The Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, used by several pre-Columbian Mesoamerican civilizations, notably the Maya, begins.

Events.text: Traditional date of the defeat of Bel by Hayk, progenitor and founder of the Armenian nation.
Events.html: Traditional date of the defeat of Bel by Hayk, progenitor and founder of the Armenian nation.

Events.text: The south-western part of Dacia (modern Romania) becomes a Roman province: Roman Dacia.
Events.html: The south-western part of Dacia (modern Romania) becomes a Roman province: Roman Dacia.

Events.text: Claudius Silvanus, accused of treason, proclaims himself Roman Emperor against Constantius II.
Events.html: Claudius Silvanus, accused of treason, proclaims himself Roman Emperor against Constantius II.

Events.text: Battle of Adda: The Goths under Theodoric the Great and his ally Alaric II defeat the forces of Odoacer on the Adda River, near Milan.
Events.html: Battle of Adda: The Goths under Theodoric the Great and his ally Alaric II defeat the forces of Odoacer on the Adda River, near Milan.

Events.text: Wars of Scottish Independence: Battle of Dupplin Moor: Scots under Domhnall II, Earl of Mar are routed by Edward Balliol.
Events.html: Wars of Scottish Independence: Battle of Dupplin Moor: Scots under Domhnall II, Earl of Mar are routed by Edward Balliol.

Events.text: The Battle of Otlukbeli: Mehmed the Conqueror of the Ottoman Empire decisively defeats Uzun Hassan of Aq Qoyunlu.
Events.html: The Battle of Otlukbeli: Mehmed the Conqueror of the Ottoman Empire decisively defeats Uzun Hassan of Aq Qoyunlu.

Events.text: Franco-Dutch War: Forces of the Holy Roman Empire defeat the French in the Battle of Konzer Brücke.
Events.html: Franco-Dutch War: Forces of the Holy Roman Empire defeat the French in the Battle of Konzer Brücke.

Events.text: Captain Francis Light establishes the British colony of Penang in Malaysia.
Events.html: Captain Francis Light establishes the British colony of Penang in Malaysia.

Events.text: Francis II assumes the title of first Emperor of Austria.
Events.html: Francis II assumes the title of first Emperor of Austria.

Events.text: Peninsular War: French troops engage British-Portuguese forces in the Battle of Majadahonda.
Events.html: Peninsular War: French troops engage British-Portuguese forces in the Battle of Majadahonda.

Events.text: In Colombia, Juan del Corral declares the independence of Antioquia.
Events.html: In Colombia, Juan del Corral declares the independence of Antioquia.

Events.text: The Eiger in the Bernese Alps is ascended for the first time by Charles Barrington accompanied by Christian Almer and Peter Bohren.
Events.html: The Eiger in the Bernese Alps is ascended for the first time by Charles Barrington accompanied by Christian Almer and Peter Bohren.

Events.text: Spanish–American War: American troops enter the city of Mayagüez, Puerto Rico.
Events.html: Spanish–American War: American troops enter the city of Mayagüez, Puerto Rico.

Events.text: World War I: The Battle of Amiens ends.
Events.html: World War I: The Battle of Amiens ends.

Events.text: The constitution of the Weimar Republic is adopted.
Events.html: The constitution of the Weimar Republic is adopted.

Events.text: The Latvian–Soviet Peace Treaty, which relinquished Russia's authority and pretenses to Latvia, is signed, ending the Latvian War of Independence.
Events.html: The Latvian–Soviet Peace Treaty, which relinquished Russia's authority and pretenses to Latvia, is signed, ending the Latvian War of Independence.

Events.text: Babe Ruth becomes the first baseball player to hit 500 home runs in his career with a home run at League Park in Cleveland, Ohio.
Events.html: Babe Ruth becomes the first baseball player to hit 500 home runs in his career with a home run at League Park in Cleveland, Ohio.

Events.text: The first civilian prisoners arrive at the Federal prison on Alcatraz Island.
Events.html: The first civilian prisoners arrive at the Federal prison on Alcatraz Island.

Events.text: Actress Hedy Lamarr and composer George Antheil receive a patent for a Frequency-hopping spread spectrum communication system that later became the basis for modern technologies in wireless telephones and Wi-Fi.
Events.html: Actress Hedy Lamarr and composer George Antheil receive a patent for a Frequency-hopping spread spectrum communication system that later became the basis for modern technologies in wireless telephones and Wi-Fi.

Events.text: Poles in Kraków engage in a pogrom against Jews in the city, killing one and wounding five.
Events.html: Poles in Kraków engage in a pogrom against Jews in the city, killing one and wounding five.

Events.text: Muhammad Ali Jinnah, founding father of Pakistan, gives a speech to the Constituent Assembly, the contents and meaning of which remain contentious today.
Events.html: Muhammad Ali Jinnah, founding father of Pakistan, gives a speech to the Constituent Assembly, the contents and meaning of which remain contentious today.

Events.text: United Nations Security Council Resolution 72 and 73 are adopted on Palestinian question.
Events.html: United Nations Security Council Resolution 72 and 73 are adopted on Palestinian question.

Events.text: Hussein bin Talal is proclaimed King of Jordan.
Events.html: Hussein bin Talal is proclaimed King of Jordan.

Events.text: Sheremetyevo International Airport, the second-largest airport in Russia, opens.
Events.html: Sheremetyevo International Airport, the second-largest airport in Russia, opens.

Events.text: Chad declares independence.
Events.html: Chad declares independence.

Events.text: The former Portuguese territories in India of Dadra and Nagar Haveli are merged to create the Union Territory Dadra and Nagar Haveli.
Events.html: The former Portuguese territories in India of Dadra and Nagar Haveli are merged to create the Union Territory Dadra and Nagar Haveli.

Events.text: Vostok 3 launches from the Baikonur Cosmodrome and cosmonaut Andrian Nikolayev becomes the first person to float in microgravity.
Events.html: Vostok 3 launches from the Baikonur Cosmodrome and cosmonaut Andrian Nikolayev becomes the first person to float in microgravity.

Events.text: Race riots (the Watts Riots) begin in the Watts area of Los Angeles, California.
Events.html: Race riots (the Watts Riots) begin in the Watts area of Los Angeles, California.

Events.text: The last steam hauled train runs on British Rail
Events.html: The last steam hauled train runs on British Rail

Events.text: Vietnam War: The last United States ground combat unit leaves South Vietnam.
Events.html: Vietnam War: The last United States ground combat unit leaves South Vietnam.

Events.text: East Timor: Governor Mário Lemos Pires of Portuguese Timor abandons the capital Dili, following a coup by the Timorese Democratic Union (UDT) and the outbreak of civil war between UDT and Fretilin.
Events.html: East Timor: Governor Mário Lemos Pires of Portuguese Timor abandons the capital Dili, following a coup by the Timorese Democratic Union (UDT) and the outbreak of civil war between UDT and Fretilin.

links.title: Revolutionary Front for an Independent East Timor

Events.text: Two Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-134s collide over the Ukrainian city of Dniprodzerzhynsk and crash, killing all 178 aboard both airliners.
Events.html: Two Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-134s collide over the Ukrainian city of Dniprodzerzhynsk and crash, killing all 178 aboard both airliners.

Events.text: A bomb explodes on Pan Am Flight 830, en route from Tokyo, Japan to Honolulu, Hawaii, killing one passenger and injuring 15 others.
Events.html: A bomb explodes on Pan Am Flight 830, en route from Tokyo, Japan to Honolulu, Hawaii, killing one passenger and injuring 15 others.

Events.text: "We begin bombing in five minutes": United States President Ronald Reagan, while running for re-election, jokes while preparing to make his weekly Saturday address on National Public Radio.
Events.html: "We begin bombing in five minutes": United States President Ronald Reagan, while running for re-election, jokes while preparing to make his weekly Saturday address on National Public Radio.

links.title: We begin bombing in five minutes

Events.text: A subway accident in Toronto kills three and injures thirty.
Events.html: A subway accident in Toronto kills three and injures thirty.

Events.text: The Salt Lake City Tornado tears through the downtown district of the city, killing one.
Events.html: The Salt Lake City Tornado tears through the downtown district of the city, killing one.

Events.text: NATO takes over command of the peacekeeping force in Afghanistan, marking its first major operation outside Europe in its 54-year-history.
Events.html: NATO takes over command of the peacekeeping force in Afghanistan, marking its first major operation outside Europe in its 54-year-history.

Events.text: Jemaah Islamiyah leader Riduan Isamuddin, better known as Hambali, is arrested in Bangkok, Thailand.
Events.html: 2003 – Jemaah Islamiyah leader Riduan Isamuddin, better known as Hambali, is arrested in Bangkok, Thailand.

Events.text: The oil tanker M/T Solar 1 sinks off the coast of Guimaras and Negros Islands in the Philippines, causing the country's worst oil spill.
Events.html: The oil tanker M/T Solar 1 sinks off the coast of Guimaras and Negros Islands in the Philippines, causing the country's worst oil spill.

Events.text: Shizuoka earthquake of magnitude 6.4 in Japan occurs.
Events.html: Shizuoka earthquake of magnitude 6.4 in Japan occurs.

Events.text: At least 306 people are killed and 3,000 others injured in a pair of earthquakes near Tabriz, Iran.
Events.html: At least 306 people are killed and 3,000 others injured in a pair of earthquakes near Tabriz, Iran.

Events.text: For the first time in Major League Baseball history, all 15 home teams won their game. Prior to this happening, the record was 12 which was reached over a century ago in 1914.
Events.html: For the first time in Major League Baseball history, all 15 home teams won their game. Prior to this happening, the record was 12 which was reached over a century ago in 1914.
